name: fishmeal and fish oil plant construction and maintenance | fishmeal plant | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/17955/documentation

The activity represents the construction and maintenance along its lifetime of a fishmeal and fish oil (reduction) plant, expressed as the installed capacity required to process 1000 kg of raw material. The life cycle inventories were produced based on a representative sample of 3 Peruvian plants and their activity. ~200 fishmeal plants existed in Peru as of 2016. This dataset may be adapted to other global production sites.;System boundaries of FMFO production and relations between activities

From construction of the plant, through maintenance.

End of life treatment of the plant
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Production figures represent the period 2005-2015, relative production of the three fishmeal types represent the period 2012-2014 (chosen due to an ongoing trend in shifting production from FAQ to Prime), and fishmeal and fish oil yields represent the period 2001-2011. Valid as of 2017.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The dataset is a weighted average of 3 different plants producing different fishmeal qualities and using two types of fuel (natural gas and residual fuel R500), representing respectively state of the art technology (indirect heat) and more conventional technology (direct heat). The three plants represent 17% of the national production in 2009-2012. Plants have a lifespan of 30 years.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Extrapolation to GLO based on the fact that the current technology is rather common in the world.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data from 3 fishmeal plants, opperated by the largest and one of the other main fish processing companies in the country. These plants are representative of the current technology and management, as determined by interviews with many technical, commercial, academic and governmental representatives.

exchanges.description: One unit of plant represents the installed capacity required to process 1 t of raw material, including annual maintenance of the infrastructure.

flow.name: fishmeal plant
flow.category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
